intro: Descurainia minutiflora var. florida, commonly known as Florida stinkweed, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is an annual herbaceous plant that typically grows in disturbed soils and open areas. The plant features small, yellow flowers that are clustered in racemes, and its leaves are alternate, ovate, and often pubescent. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many other flowering plants with similar floral structures. The plant is known for its strong, unpleasant odor, which is most noticeable when the flowers are in bloom.
